pages.text: Energy Bees are the foundation of the ApiElectric system. These specialized bees have evolved to collect and process energy rather than pollen and nectar.$(br2)With their distinctive golden glow, Energy Bees transform charged pollen into HoneyCharge, a powerful energy source.
Energy Bees have a golden glow that intensifies when they're carrying charged pollen.

pages.title: Spawning
pages.text: There are two ways to obtain Energy Bees:$(br)1. Use an Energy Bee Spawn Egg$(br)2. Place an Energy Bee Spawner, which will automatically spawn bees over time$(br2)Energy Bee Spawners are generally more efficient for maintaining a steady population.

pages.title: Behavior
pages.text: Energy Bees will:$(br)- Seek out Energized Flowers$(br)- Collect charged pollen$(br)- Return to Energy Apiaries$(br)- Generate HoneyCharge$(br2)They have a limited range of about 20 blocks from their home apiary.

pages.title: Energy Bee Spawner
pages.text: The Energy Bee Spawner will:$(br)- Spawn a new Energy Bee every 60 seconds$(br)- Maintain up to 10 bees within a 10-block radius$(br)- Require no additional resources or energy$(br2)Right-click the spawner to check how many bees are currently in range.

pages.title: Crafting
pages.text: The Energy Bee Spawner is crafted with iron ingots and a honeycomb, making it an affordable early-game investment.
